questions.question_text:
An administrator has been tasked with deploying a VMware Cloud Foundation Workload Domain Stretched Cluster that consists of eight (8) hosts. Four (4) hosts have been successfully deployed and commissioned into Availability Zone 1 (AZ1).
All other required prerequisites have been met, and the administrator is now ready to start the process of stretching the VMware vSAN cluster into Availability Zone 2 (AZ2).
Which step should the administrator complete first?

choices.D: Create a network pool in AZ2.
choices.A: Commission the four (4) hosts in AZ2.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
since all the requirement are ready, now you are ready to host commission

Selected Answer: A
you must migrate, the VM to a new Cluster, since is not mgmt 3 host can be part of the new Cluster inthe provisioned VI WLD

A is correct. 

D could have been correct however you only need a minimum of 3 hosts for a VI workload domain, not 4 hosts so answer is A

Selected Answer: A
D is incorrect as a Workload Domain can be provisioned with less than 4 hosts

choices.D: Commission a minimum of four hosts per domain.
choices.B: Migrate using VMware Lifecycle Manager to the new VI Workload Domain.
choices.A: Extend the existing workload networking into the new VI Workload Domain.
choices.C: Migrate the Resource Pools from Management Domain to the Workload Domain.

questions.question_text: What is a prerequisite to support a migration of workload VMs from a consolidated architecture to a standard architecture?

choices.D: VMware Cloud Foundation Multi-Instance Management does not support consolidated deployment architectures.
choices.B: Consolidated architecture does not align with the VMware best practice of separating management workloads from customer workloads.
choices.F: Management and user workloads are running under management vCenter.
choices.C: Resource pools with shares, limits, and reservations must be used to isolate workloads when they coexist in the management cluster.
choices.A: Future migration from a consolidated architecture to a standard architecture will be possible only if VMware Cloud Foundation on VxRail deployment takes place.
choices.E: The consolidated architecture design targets bigger VMware Cloud Foundation deployments.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCF
BCF as the majority

Selected Answer: BCF
BCF since the other 3 statements are incorrect.

Selected Answer: BCF
E is wrong as Consolidated architecture is for only small deployments

Selected Answer: BC
E is wrong as Consolidated architecture is for only small deployments

questions.question_text:
A customer has decided to combine management and user workloads into one domain.
Which three considerations for designing consolidated architecture of VMware Cloud Foundation must be noted? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct : https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/4.5/vcf-deploy/GUID-2FF9A809-B2DF-43EF-8838-21DCB3DF5E8E.html

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B

questions.question_text:
A system administrator wants to configure 2 pNICs and 1 vDS, which is used for Management Traffic, vMotion, vSAN, Host Overlay, Edge Overlay, and Uplink networks.
Which vDS profile does the administrator needs to set?
